title: What is the difference between front-end and back-end? - Quora

response.answer_text: Basically every website you surf has two parts. Front-End and Back-End. Whatever you see, the user interface, whatever you deal with while browsing a website comes under Front-End. Basic languages that are used for front end web development are HTML , CSS, JS. With the use of these languages the job of creating front end of website is accomplished. The back end of a website consists of a server, an application, and a database. A back-end developer builds and maintains the technology that powers those components which, together, enable the user-facing side of the website to even exist in the first place. There are several languages used for back-end. PHP, JS(Node JS), .NET(C#,VB) and many others.

Basic of Back-end and Front-end. Back-end : When you register to web application, you will enter all your details and click submit button, and once again when you login you can see all your details in that web app, So where the details get stored is back end. Front-end : Whatever you see in the website or web app is front end.
You can see the answer here.
